data.title: Mark Dempsey
data.text:
Mark Dempsey holds a Bachelor of Arts in European Studies from Ulster University and a Master of Science in European Economics and Public Affairs from University College Dublin. At the Hertie School, he undertook the EMPA over two years part-time, where he took the digitalisation and big data concentration with a particular focus on EU digital policy and governance. Mark has worked in development finance as a Regional Director for a US development finance NGO where he oversaw their programmes in the MENA region, in finance (Deutsche BÃ¶rse Group and BNP Paribas) and in EU financial policy for the UK Government at the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA). Mark has lived in Frankfurt, Dublin, Mumbai, Amman and Beirut and upon completion of the EMPA, he will move to Brussels to work on EU digital policy.

Master's thesis title

The Brussels Effect and EU regulatory power: The impact of the GDPR in Africa

Recent professional experience

Oct. 2019 - Aug. 2021: Independent Consultant and part-time work, Germany. EU Policy Advisor and Mentor.

Feb. 2016 - Aug. 2019: Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), UK. EU Policy Advisor.

Jan. 2015 - Jan. 2016: TrustElevate, UK. Policy Consultant.

Jan. 2013 - Dec. 2014: Brehon Advisory (international development consulting), UK. Director and Co-founder.

Nov. 2008 - Feb 2012: Financial Services Volunteer Corps (FSVC), Jordan and Lebanon. Regional Director.

Education
